alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Donley; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 12:53PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Armstrong, south central Gray and northern Donley Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1253 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Goodnight, or 15 miles southeast of Claude, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarendon, Howardwick, Lake Mcclellan, Greenbelt Lake, and Goodnight. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
